claim: Mercedes gained more new social media followers than any other constructor during the season it finished with the highest points total.
reasoning: The database contains only Formula 1 race and competition data (results, standings, lap times, etc.). There is no table or column related to social media followers, so it is impossible to verify the claim about Mercedes gaining more new social media followers than any other constructor.

content.content:
CREATE TABLE constructorStandings
(
    constructorStandingsId INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,
    raceId                 INTEGER default 0 not null,
    constructorId          INTEGER default 0 not null,
    points                 REAL   default 0 not null,
    position               INTEGER,
    positionText           TEXT,
    wins                   INTEGER default 0 not null,
    foreign key (raceId) references races(raceId),
    foreign key (constructorId) references constructors(constructorId)
);
---
CREATE TABLE constructors
(
    constructorId  INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,
    constructorRef TEXT default '' not null,
    name           TEXT default '' not null
        unique,
    nationality    TEXT,
    url            TEXT default '' not null
);
---
CREATE TABLE constructorResults
(
    constructorResultsId INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,
    raceId               INTEGER default 0 not null,
    constructorId        INTEGER default 0 not null,
    points               REAL,
    status               TEXT,
    foreign key (raceId) references races(raceId),
    foreign key (constructorId) references constructors(constructorId)

);

    url            TEXT default '' not null

    constructorId        INTEGER default 0 not null,
    points               REAL,
    status               TEXT,
    foreign key (raceId) references races(raceId),
    foreign key (constructorId) references constructors(constructorId)

input.description: Check schemas of races and seasons tables

content.content:
CREATE TABLE races
(
    raceId    INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,
    year      INTEGER default 0            not null,
    round     INTEGER default 0            not null,
    circuitId INTEGER default 0            not null,
    name      TEXT    default ''           not null,
    date      DATE    default '0000-00-00' not null,
    time      TEXT,
    url       TEXT unique,
    foreign key (year) references seasons(year),
    foreign key (circuitId) references circuits(circuitId)
);
---
CREATE TABLE seasons
(
    year INTEGER default 0  not null
        primary key,
    url  TEXT    default '' not null
        unique
);

    name      TEXT    default ''           not null,
    date      DATE    default '0000-00-00' not null,
    time      TEXT,
    url       TEXT unique,
    foreign key (year) references seasons(year),
    foreign key (circuitId) references circuits(circuitId)
);
---
CREATE TABLE seasons
(
    year INTEGER default 0  not null
        primary key,
    url  TEXT    default '' not null
        unique
);

content.text:
The database does not contain any table with social media follower data. The tables only cover race results, standings, circuits, drivers, constructors, lap times, pit stops, qualifying, and seasons — all race/competition data.
